reviewText: I love these bars for snacks, lunches, pre or post workout, anything really. They taste great and fill you up! Plus they are nutritious. A tad high in sugar, but I don't eat a lot of sugar anyways.

This review is for the Double Chocolate Crisp flavour.First off, the flavour is exactly like a dessert. Some might be put off by that, I'm not though. It's chewy and goes down a bit chalky though, so definitely DO drink with water or some other liquid. These could *potentially* be used as a meal replacement bar, if not eaten everyday because you might tire of eating the dessert flavour weekly.I purchased mine at Walmart and they're always on sale. But if you purchase from Amazon you'll stave off having to stand in a 20 minute line!
summary: Pretty sweet... in a good way!

reviewText: These bars are the best, tried several flavors and brands and keep coming back to these, Toffee Chocolate Chip being the best!~
I love these bars for on the go. i take one to school in my bookbag and just eat it before i head to the gym.
These power bars taste great ,maybe its just me . My kids love them too. What else needs to be said
The bars arrived on time but they tasted stale. I didn't want to deal with returning so I did not complain but I will not buy them again from the same supplier.

This granola type bar was quite tasty and had a great texture to go along with it. The consistency of it was some where between the crunchy granola bars and the chewy ones; perfect.the only two down sides i saw to the one i tried (cranberry oatmeal cookie) was the fact that a) it had no vitamin c and yet had cranberries and b)really sweet, though I guess that is the "cookie" part.Edit 2/13/13: I have since tried the peanut butter flavored and come to prefer it over the overly sweetness of the cranberry oatmeal cookie. They make a great on the go breakfast.

I buy these by the box from my local grocer but the last two boxes were stale and too crunchy to chew.So, I purchased online after the PowerBar people told me this was probably a "storage irregularity on the part of the grocer".The box  bought online was no different.I contacted the Powerbar Company and they sent a postage paid label to mail back the grocery-purchased box, which I did but am waiting to hear from them. They were courteous, prompt and very helpful.Upon inspection, I believe the problem is that they are making the bar smaller but the wrapper is the original size, which allows foran air-space, causing the texture of the bar to become impossible to bite into.Have used these bars for years, I hope they can get the quality control end of things worked out.
summary: Too stale to eat, need to return

reviewText: I make no claims to sports nutrition (or any nutrition for that matter)expertise, so I'll just call it a snack, and leave its place in your exercise program between you and your personal doctor/nutritionist/coach/guru. However, I will say that this is a much better than average tasting sports bar/snack (name your preference), free of the cardboad-ish and stale texture and barely identifiable aftertastes common to similar products.While noone will compare this to a real apple crisp, this convenient food for those on the go has recognizable tastes of oats (this flavor and texture predominates), apple, and cinnamon, due in large part, I suspect, to the fact that it actually contains those ingredients! There are also raisins, cane and other sugars--including fructose from fruit juices-- giving it a sweet but not cloying (as they say at the wineries) taste. This company is known for its quality ingredients and generally consumer-friendly face; you can read more about them at powerbar.com. The company recommends consuming this with water to aid the absorption of the many added nutrients--this also gives one a more "full" feeling. One of the better tasting snacks of this type; I've listed nutritional information and ingredients (from the web site) below.Nutritional Information:*Percent Daily Values (DV) are based on a 2,000 calorie diet.In one Serving Size (One Bar; total=65 grams), there are 240 calories and 35 calories from fat 35 (6% of DV). Total Fat=4grams (g) (6% of DV), which includes  0.5 grams of Saturated Fat (3%)and 0 g (as in none) Trans Fat. No Cholesterol and 140 mg of sodium (6%). Total Carbohydrates = 42g (14%), of which fiber is 5g (20%), and sugars, 20g. (Does anyone carbo-load anymore?).  Protein 10g (16%)Vitamins and Minerals:Vitamin A (20%), Vitamin C (80%), Calcium (40%), Iron (25%),  Vitamin E (80%), Thiamin (40%), Riboflavin (40%), Niacin (40%), Vitamin B6 (40%), Folate (80%  Vitamin B12 (80%), Biotin (40%), Pantothenic Acid (80%), Phosphorus (20%  Magnesium (20%), Zinc (20%), Copper (20%), Chromium (20%), Vitamin K (20%), Iodine (20%), Manganese (20%), Molybdenum (20%), Selenium (20%),Ingredients:Whole Oats, Brown Rice Syrup, Rice Crisps (Milled Rice, Sugar, Salt, Barley Malt), Dried Apples, Evaporated Cane Juice Syrup, Raisins, Roasted Soy Beans, Almond Butter, Honey, Pear and Grape Juice Concentrate, Brown Rice Flour, Soy Protein Isolate, Glycerin, Natural Flavors, Cinnamon, Nonfat Milk.Possible Allergens: Contains milk, nut and soy ingredients. Made on equipment that also processed peanuts and wheat.Salud!
summary: 4 1/2  A Apple Crisp A Day Does...Something for You

reviewText: (NOTE: I think they may sometimes make slight revisions to the ingredients and/or nutritional analysis. You could compare my ingredient list to theirs as a way to check whether this review covers the exact same product on this page.)Perhaps the best thing that can be said about this flavor of Power Bar is that it fills you up, and it's not an unpleasant experience.  Perhaps the one I tried had been sitting on the shelf for too long, but it definitely did not taste "fresh-picked," as touted on the Power Bar website. Instead, there was a suggestion of strawberry flavor despite the presence of large pieces of dried fruit.  There was a nice taste of oat flakes--whole oats are the bar's main ingredient (see below).  Alongside this flavor was a cardboard-like texture that definitely fills you up but that tastes tale and gummy.That said, the power bar does fill you up, especially if you drink the suggested 8 glasses of water with it (they don't say over what time interval).  There are 45 grams of carbs, of which 18 are sugar and 4 are fiber.  I don't know what happened to the other 23 grams.  In addition there are 4 grams of fat, 0.5 grams of which are saturated, 7 grams of protein, 240 calories (35 from fat), no cholesterol, and 80 mg of sodium. Those with nut allergies may want to know that the product is made on equipment that also processes peanuts and nuts.  Nothing organic and a heavy reliance on vitamin additives may turn some people off to these, but they're a quick and filling portable snack.INGREDIENTS: Whole Oats, Brown Rice Syrup, Dried Strawberries (Strawberries, Sugar, Rice Flour, Ascorbic Acid, Sunflower Oil), Rice Crisps (Milled Rice, Sugar, Salt, Barley Malt), Brown Rice Evaporated Cane Juice Syrup, Dried Cranberries (Sugar, Cranberries, Sunflower Oil), Roasted Soy Beans, Almond Butter, Honey, Pear and Grape Juice Concentrates, Soy Protein Isolate, Natural Flavors, Glycerin, Nonfat Dry Milk.MINERALS and Percent Daily Value Based on 2,000 calorie diet:: 15% of calcium, phosphorus, (Calcium Phosphate), magnesium (Magnesium Carbonate), zinc (Zinc Gluconate), Iron (Ferrous Fumarate), and copper (Copper Gluconate).VITAMINS: 100% of Vitamin C (Ascorbic Acid)  and Vitamin E Acetate (100%). 50% of Vitamin B3 (Niacin),  Pantothenic Acid (Calcium Pantothenate), Vitamin B6 (Pyridoxine Hydrochloride), Vitamin B2 (Riboflavin), Vitamin B1 (Thiamin Mononitrate), Folate (Folic Acid), Biotin, and Vitamin B12. 15% of of Phosphorus,  Zinc, Copper, and Magnesium.
great flavor, really liked the mix between the granola and the yogurt side. Need some liquids to digest, can become a little dry wothout them.
great product as the rest of the power bars... not to dry so it is easy to eat even without mixing it up with liquid
These bars are really good.  Not too bad for you, great taste, texture is nice and chewy.  Flavor is delicious, peanut butter, YUM.  And yes they give you a good burst of energy.
Not bad as a snack on the trail, not as tasty as Clif, but good enough.
I got these to give myself a healthy afternoon snack, and these do the trick.  Taste pretty good and they cure that 3pm hunger to allow you to get to dinner without feeling famished.
summary: Pretty good taste, good afternoon snack

reviewText: We like these. My husband really liked these bars but I prefer the more natural tasting, less sweet snacks. I give it a thumbs up though because it is full of complete nutrients.
I was a little disappointed in the taste, I felt it had an aftertaste.  I love some of the other ones just not this one.

I use these as a pre workout snack and they are perfect.  The macros are friendly and I can feel a real boost that takes me through 90 minutes of weights and cardio.  And these taste better than any other PowerBar I have tried.
The bars are dry and tasteless. Like a year old rice crispie treat. Nasty and stale.
My teenage daughter loves to carry these in her bookbag for times during the school day when she needs something to eat that's not just junk food like candy or chips.

Let me just say that I LOVE these toffee chocolate chip power bars (and have been eating them for 2-3+ years now).  I always get a craving for chocolate, and these satisfy that craving, while giving me energy and nutrition.  I generally have one or two of these power bars before going off to work in the morning, and they keep me going for generally 5+ hours (before I get hungry enough for lunch).  Sometimes I've even gone throughout the work day on my 2 morning power bars (when I've been incredibly busy).  I will say that I go through a LOT of these each week, as I'll often eat them in addition to meals, inbetween meals, or in the case of breakfast, substituting for a meal.  I'd say I have anywhere from 14 to 28 of these per week (2-4 per day), in addition to lunches and dinners--I do work out in the gym, though, so the extra calories are not an issue.Edit: These bars replaced my 'Take Five' bars, which also satisfied my chocolate cravings, but were very unhealthy. [...]--11g total fat, 5g sat fat, 1g fiber, 4g protein, barely any vitamins, and still close in calories (200) and sugar (18g)Cheers!Michael
summary: PowerBar Harvest Toffee Chocolate Chip Bars Are GREAT!

reviewText: I'm quite satisfied with its quantity, quality and ingredients. The only thing makes it less satisfying is that it's not sweet enough for me.

They are also good for you, the main ingredient is whole oats*. I keep a few in my car whenever I can't stop for lunch, they are also good with a cup a coffee in the morning. I also take them on hikes and bike rides, the protein and carbs keep me going. Amazon has the best price when you buy them by the case!*When buying Power Bars look at the label: "1 & 2" or "Harvest Energy" bars have oats and are designed for energy, "3" or "Triple Threat" bars are mainly glucose and are designed for post workout.

This was actually a really good bar.  I enjoyed the flavor and it managed to fill me up in place of a regular breakfast.  I didn't get hungry until at least three hours later (and for me that is actually pretty good, I'm always hungry).The main flavor of this bar was the peanut butter. The chocolate barely made an appearance and that was just fine for me.  It was just a surprise here and there when you hit a chip.  The bar was chewy, but not really crunchy from the oats and other grains and fibers that were included in the bar.  It was sweet, and that's to be expected from the sweeteners of brown rice syrup, honey, evaporated can juice syrup and the chocolate chips.  Lots of sweeteners in here making the bar content of sugar 18 grams.  So that is something to watch.The rest of the ingredients were good.  There's whole oats, rice flour, and other pronounceable ingredients throughout.  And a whole list of minerals and vitamins is included so it's even somewhat nutritional for you.  But there are a lot of allergens here as well, as is obvious by the peanut butter flavor.  And another thing of note is that this bar packs a walloping 240 calories.  So use it as a meal replacement or for during vigorous exercise as opposed to a snack.  It would definitely be a good bar for a hiking trip.I liked it and will probably consider it again for breakfast.  It kept me full and I liked the taste, and it will have inspired me to try other PowerBar flavors as well.Review by M. Reynard 2012
summary: Powerbar Harvest Peanut Butter Chocolate Chip Bar

reviewText: A very tasty and satisfying bar--great when get those afternoon cravings or when don't have time to eat a real meal.  Not too sweet but helps satisfy sweet tooth but not the sugar rush of other higher fat so-called energy bars.
summary: Powerbar Harvest Whole Grain bar--very satisfying

reviewText: I got it for a good price ordering recurring shipment.  However, I would like to try someother for taste.  The taste is just ok to me.

These taste great and come in handy on long runs or hikes, when I want something solid. They are a little expensive compared to something like Nature Valley's bars, so I try to ration them out between other bars. I'm a fan of many of the PowerBar products, the gels, performance bars, and these simple energy bars. The Peanut Butter ones are pretty good, but not as good as these.
summary: Great bars for on the go.

reviewText: This is my favorite flavor. It's chewy (not dry) and pretty filling. A good lunch substitute on really busy work days... or a great snack for a normal person. :)
Good amount of protein without being chalky or overbearing.  I have a few in my backpack and in my office drawer. Great for on the run or when I know my meetings are going to run long.
These are quite good.  Good bar on the go.  Very filling and better for you than store options.  Will buy again.

Nuts and just the right blend of sweetness and saltiness.  The only bar I've ever really liked and I've tried a bunch!  So glad I found these.  Most of those claiming to have nuts only seem to have nut mash in them.  These have whole nuts one can taste and a very nice crunchiness so I don't miss cookies.
excellent taste (and I'm pretty finicky), in fact it's almost too good....my daughter the choco-haulic says it's too rich....go figure.....

Realizing that "taste" is subjective, IMHO this is the best tasting Energy bar out there and I've tried quite a few. I've used these bars along with a meal-replacement shake (Lean Shake from GNC) to lose about 25 lbs over the past 4-5 months. The Oatmeal Raisin PowerBars are tasty so you don't feel like it's a chore to eat one. They are fairly nutritious - 250 calories, 5g fat (2g saturated), 5g fiber, 10g protein. The only real less-than-optimal nutritional aspect is the 22g of sugar (more than 1/2 the total carbs are sugar). But, that's undoubtedly why this thing tastes as good as it does. It has worked for me! Also, Amazon has the best price I've found for the bulk buy pack of 15.
summary: best tasting energy bar out there

reviewText: I love this product, and they do not melt in the gym bag.  I love having them on hand for a quick breakfast or after work out snack.

Headline pretty much says it all.  They taste pretty good, but seemed somewhat stale to me.  I couldn't compare them to a fresh bar, because these were all I had.  However, seeing that I received them a month before the expiration date, they probably are stale.  Anyway, be careful when purchasing these.  You might be better off just buying them at Sam's or something.
summary: Good taste, recieved and month before the expiration

reviewText: I have one of these every morning for breakfast.  Just enough sugar and fiber to last until lunch . . . I sure hope that they keep making them forever! ! !
summary: Beast for Breakfast and Bike rides

reviewText: tasty snack.  a little too sweet for me.  size of each individual bar seems small and one bar is not satisfying.  try the subscription option from Amazon for a better deal.
these energy bars taste as good as any energy bar i have tried.  subscribe and save with this item so you get a better price.
Really tasty.I do not like eating food that is too dry, and those are really good and not dry at all.Perfect before going to the gym.
This bar works for me - I have it every weekday morning at the office with my first cup of coffee. The protein bar keeps me satisfied until lunch. At 250 calories, a good way to start the day.

Bought these as part of a "buy two boxes, get a $10 gift certificate" deal.  Bought it in April, still haven't received the gift cert.Anyways, back to the bars.  They're ok.  Not my first (or second) choices, but they were part of the promotion and since I eat power bars all the time anyways, I just bought them.  I'd get a tastier flavor if they were available.

these are absolutely delicious, but I ordered this item and the one i got was this item but it was the old wrapper and the expiration date was only like five months away.  I mean I didn't mind so much that the wrapper was old, but the fact that the bars themselves were actually old.  Usually when I buy these bars in the local drugstore, they don't expire for a least another year or more.
I love the chocolate flavor with an added crunchy texture.  It really satisifies my cravings and gives me lasting energy.
Tastes great and really holds you over if you're hungry. As a bonus, got them much cheaper than you would any store.

I love these!  They are more "granola bar" than "Power Bar".  They only problem is if you eat one everyday for two months you get pretty tired of the taste :) They are a little bit dry, so with coffee or juice is perfect.  I think that goes with just about anything.  I highly recommend these to anyone looking for a good supplement bar.

If you are a fan of peanut butter and chocolate, than this bar is for you.  I've tried a number of energy bars and they all suffer from one problem -- bland taste and usually end up leaving a gritty aftertaste in my mouth.  Not so with PowerBar.I make a PowerBar part of my regular morning routine.  After trying a few of the other flavors I finally stumbled upon the peanut butter and chocolate chip and was "hooked".  The flavor is just right and the crispness of the bar is not too hard, but firm enough to make you "feel" like you are eating a full meal.  One bar will usually kill any cravings I have all throughout the morning.

I use the powerbar during my two hour mountain bike rides, I get the energy I need by eating one before the ride and usually one during my 25 miles.  They taste great and are lower in calories than most other bars.  We also keep a couple in the all cars for a quick pick me up when traveling.
I use these for breargetickfast and before long runs. They taste pretty good, not like some other bars I've tried.
Satisfying snack between meals or before exercising keeping you feeling full and energized for an extended period of time. Good nutritional value and the cost is reasonable.

Seems like the only place I can find these are single service at the convenience store for $2.29 a pop. Grocery stores don't carry them, at least not in my area. Happy to be able to get these and at a decent price. They are great for a breakfast replacement or even an afterworkout bar. Good amount of protein and they taste great.

I love these bars. I love them so much that, when I couldn't find them after a recent move, I bought two boxes online. I eat them when engaging in moderate-intensity activities, like all-day climbing trips, and I never get tired of them... seriously, just like candy. :) :) And they have a lower GI score than Clif Bars, so they're perfect for maintaining high energy throughout the day without a nasty crash.

Love these things before a work out, they provide some good energy to push me through.  The crisp powerbars are my favorite, they really don't have that chalky kind of after taste to them like some other energy bars.
There's a vague taste of apple cinnamon, but mostly I taste oats. I do love that these fill me up and keep me full for awhile. They are exactly what I needed.
I gave this product a five star rating.  Finally a good tasting bar that doesn't break your teeth trying to eat it!  Chewy and very good!  My favorite!
these were great.  they made a Marine platoon very happy for extra energy before their personal fitness and platoon fitness ad combat training.

I first tried this bar at my office canteen where it is sold for $2. I got hooked to it right then and now I find Amazon sells it for almost a $1 cheaper. It is a great grab and go bar for snacking as it is not only rich in proteins but also loaded with fiber, calcium and vitamins. it is a great wholesome bar. I have this regularly.

Havent tried these bars in years, but trying to snack more healthy at work.  These bars, the chocolate crisp, taste pretty decent and definitely fill you up.  Great for a pre-workout or run as well.  I would recommend.

The whole family likes these, but the reason I'm such a big fan is that my son likes them. I have an 8 year old who is a really fussy eater.  He loves these, and they're so good for them.  I also like that I can stick them in my purse and they aren't too delicate--they'll last in there until we're stuck somewhere and my child is starving.  The double chocolate crisp is our favorite flavor.

Ever since they discontinued my favorite Kashi breakfast bars, I've been looking for a suitable substitute. Although I haven't found anything quite as complete and cost effective as what I was buying, these are a close second. I'm not a morning person and often don't leave time to eat breakfast. These have enough protein and fiber to satisfy me for several hours until lunch time (but might not for a large man) and I can't get too cranky about paying less than $1.50 for a meal (using subscribe&save). This flavor is tasty and there are several other flavors I can rotate to decrease boredom.
this bar is a good way to bridge breakfast and lunch. i also use on hikes on the AT and PCT.
My husband takes one of these to work with him everyday as well as keeping a couple in his gig bag.  This is the cheapest place i have found to buy them as well.  Thanks!
Very good price, son loves the taste, eats them for breakfast, or beforeor after workouts, before football. Packaged nice.

Out of all the types of powerbars I have tried, these are the best. Great for between meals, on the go and for a snack. Great taste. If you like chocolate you will like these. I buy them through Amazon, because they seem to be hard to find in stores now and the price is better then the stores.

I prefer these semi soft granola bars over the traditional nutrient bars and granola bars mainly because of mouth feel and messiness.  It is not as thick to get in your teeth like sports bars and it's no where near as crumbly as a dry granola bar.  The flavor is good, although it is a little artificial.

I have been eating the Toffee Harvest bars for years!  After trying dozens of brands and flavors, I always come back to these.  They taste great, keep me full, and are healthy!  I order two boxes per month.  Even my children will eat them!
I cant find these anywhere except 1 local gas station for 1.79 each. Eat one before and one after your workout.
I order these for my husband and he loves them.  Not too sweet and very "nutty."
These have a great apple flavor and sort of a soft granola consistency.  They are a little sweet so I eat them for breakfast with black coffee.

I have had other energy bars and all that I have found have been chewy.  This one I picked up on a 50 mile ride from a local bike shop - and the crunch was great.  The taste is very chocolatey - which is not a problem since I like chocolate.

I've found Harvest bars to be the best healthy snack bar.  We often sacrifice taste in many of the bars (like Power Bars), but these are crunchy, tasty, with the best of the taste of granola with raisins.

I've settled on a few PowerBars that are my favorites. This Nut Naturals is one of them. They are crunchy, even brittle - make no mistake. They are almost like a peanut brittle, just much better for you.I like them because:1) I love peanuts. Put peanuts in it and I'm there.2) They are not at all sweet. The other Nut Naturals: Trail Mix, is a little sweeter and although a favorite, is not quite as good as this one.Since you've read this far, my other PowerBar favorites are1) Triple Threat: Caramel Peanut Fusion (see what I mean about peanuts?).2) Triple Threat: Chocolate Peanut Butter Crisp (peanuts / peanut butter - same difference). These are crispy but not brittle like the Mixed Nuts varieties.Most Clif Bars are up there too, less crunchy, less chocolate-y, more chewy.Don't go and buy 'em all so I can't have any!
summary: a great alternative to a candy bar

reviewText: Last few times I ordered these they were $14.59 a box (15 bars).Now the price is $35.05 a box (still 15 bars)?!?I can (and will) buy them locally for that.
summary: Good product but why has the price doubled?

reviewText: These bars are excellent.  They taste great and are a great midmorning or midafternoon snack to keep you away from the unhealthy alternatives.  They are filling, have adequate protein content for the "normal", healthy person.  If you are a bodybuilder you should look for something more than this bar provides.
summary: Excellent Combination of Nutrition and Taste

reviewText: I have eaten Power Bar Harvest Energy Bars for years in a pinch when I could not take the time for a lunch break, or wanted a healthier-than average snack.  Apple Cinnamon Crisp is my favorite, but I also like the Strawberry flavor; will eat the Oatmeal Raisin or Peanut Butter Chocolate Chip if I must.  Years ago, there was a Blueberry flavor, but it has not been availabe for some time.  It is much better tasting that the average energy bar- none of that chalky, fakey-sweet flavor.  If you are expecting a super-sweet treat, like a candy bar, pass this up.  If you want something reasonably healthy that will tide you over until the next meal, give this a try.
summary: My go-to snack food and emergency meal replacement!

reviewText: I have these as my only auto-ship product right now. They're easy breakfast and delicious (to a guy who mainly eats toast and fruit cups)!
summary: Why didnt you already order these..and can I have one?

reviewText: This is a good energy bar (for me anyway)  I had it on a subscription for 6 months.  Ended the subscription because wanted to change it up a bit.  I will probably reorder on a limited basis instead.
summary: Good product at a fair price

reviewText: Should buy these at the store instead of online. Expiration date says October, but these taste stale aleady. Other reviewers have indicated that theirs tasted stale, also. Will be sending back.
One of our favorite traditional power bar flavors.  Almost impossible to find them in the store so was happy to find an online source.  Still tastes great.
I ordered 3 types of Power Bar.  None of them tastes fresh.  The expiration date isn't until September (it's June now) but I think these bars are stale.  I won't be reordering.

Although all of us like a little variety in our diets, these bars have become a staple for my wife and me. They are the best tasting bars out there in our opinion (who doesn't like chocolate right?) and can work as either a snack or light meal. We like them so much, we set up an Amazon monthly shipment so we won't run out.
summary: PowerBar Harvest Chocolate Bars - Tasty Energy to go

reviewText: A huge part of my diet consists of eating bars; with 3 kids and running a few businesses, I have time issues.  Until recently, I would grab a bar in between meals.  Not too long ago, bars took on a whole new meaning in my life when I tried the "Cookie Diet."For a couple of weeks, I was buying the cookies from "my Center".  One day, out of curiosity I decided to take the ingredients of the diet cookie I was eating to the local Sprouts to see if there was a bar that had the same makeup.  This was when I discovered the PowerBar Pure and Simple Roasted Peanut Butter bar. This bar was a true find: (1) the nutritional value matched the cookie almost exactly; (2) the bar was so much cheaper; and (3) the bar was so much better tasting than the cookie.The Bar is light and tasty.  I agree with the reviewer that said they need more flavors; I am not a fan of the Cranberry Oatmeal.Not going to satisfy you like one of the more caloric bars but is great at taking care of you until your next meal.
summary: Perfect Bar When On A Diet

reviewText: Yummy with none of that health bar grit or cardboard flavor. Easily used as a meal replcament without the high calories of many others. I would highly recommend!

It really does provide energy for when I bike to work. The only reason why I didn't give it 5 was that I kinda don't like the texture. It's not crunchy like a granola bar, or soft like something else. It's in between to where you can't just quickly chew it and swallow it. IDK it's weird. lol.
These granola bars are really delicious and are great to take along on a hike.  I enjoy them as a snack or as a meal replacement while hiking.  Excellent, wholesome, and delicious!
Breathe easy actually works to cut down on my nasal congestions when my alleges act up. The flavor is mostly licorice.

Traditional Medicinals' "Breathe Easy" is an amazing tea. A couple of times I've had asthma attacks, it's clearing powers have worked! It's a delicious,spicy mix of Egyptian licorice, peppermint, ginger, and eucalyptus. It's the drinkable Vaposteam&its benefits are incredible. Traditional Medicinals is based in beautiful Sebastopol, California, and its healing herbs come from their garden!

I bought this to compare it against Yogi Tea's "Breathe Deep" tea because of the lower cost.  It's pleasant enough but I prefer the Yogi Tea better.  This brand tastes good but seems to be less effective in clearing a cough or congestion than Yogi Tea.
I live on Breathe Easy and Throat Coat in the winter, when the powerful germs of my students overtake me.

My husband has asthma. He uses peventative inhalers along with inhalers when an attack occurs. When the attack is severe he will go into the bathroom and turn the shower on hot, to inhale the steam.  Even doing all of this, the attack will continue until I prepare him the Breathe Easy Herbal Tea.  Within minutes after drinking the tea the asthma settles down. I ALWAYS carry a tea bag with me.  I never leave the house to go anywhere without the tea.  IT IS A LIFE SAVER!!!!!Even if you do not have asthma the tea will also help you breathe better with respiratory infections.  Just recently I had the flu for several weeks with much coughing the tea was AWESOME.  A MUST HAVE FOR ANY BREATHING AILMENT.............

For the past months, I've suffered from very regular sinus congestion. If you're considering this product, I'm sure you know how frustrating it can be not to be able to breathe properly.This tea does wonders. As I drink it, my sinuses clear up remarkably, and I can finally breathe the way I want to. It's a tremendous relief! So when I have those moments that I just can't stand the congestion, I'll definitely turn to this tea. Still looking for a long-term solution, but I'll keep this on my shelf until I find it.The downside is that, while the taste is initially pleasant, it leaves an annoyingly sweet aftertaste at the back of my mouth. Yuck...but worth it!
summary: Cloyingly sweet aftertaste, but totally worth it

reviewText: For those of us with pulmonary conditions [e.g., asthma]  this tea is great!  And, as a tea lover, I have used it successfully  and enjoyed so doing.

We have been using this tea for years for chest congestion and nagging coughs.  The ingredients are gentle and very pleasant tasting and work great to temporarily relieve a cough.As licorice root and fennel are two of its main ingredients, it definitely has a very slight (but not at all overpowering) licorice flavor.  You can also taste slight blends of eucalyptus, peppermint and ginger (which help to settle your stomach as well as relieve other cold symptoms you might be experiencing).Obviously, if any symptoms are very long term, nothing replaces a doctor's care, but this can definitely help with some short term, common cold or flu cough symptoms.Also great for a vocal boost for singers/actors before a performance!
summary: Great tasting and excellent for relieving cough/chest congestion

reviewerName: Caroline Kenner from The Fool's Dog
reviewText: If you are having difficulty breathing due to a viral infection or chronic asthma, this tea is for you.  I keep it on hand all the time in case someone in our family develops a cough.In addition to various Western herbs that support clear breathing, such as Eucalyptus and Pleurisy Root, the tea has the traditional Chinese herbal mixture Bi Yan Pan in it.  This is the magic ingredient that helps clear mucous out of the lungs.I am grateful that Amazon carries the entire Traditional Medicinals line because sometimes it is hard to find Breathe Easy tea in stores.  There are a variety of competitors on the market with other teas that claim to provide relief for breathing difficulties, but Breathe Easy outclasses all others I have tried.  Plus, it has a pleasant flavor from Licorice and Peppermint, especially compared to other herbal teas that have perceptible medical effects.  I highly recommend Breathe Easy tea.

I have been using Breathe Easy for years.  If you have a cold or think you might be coming down with one, a cup of this helps ease the symptoms and clear the sinuses.  I prefer this over decongestant cough medicine.

I am not a doctor and can't officially make any statement, recommendation, or prescription regarding health, etc. That being said I have my family take this for their breathing issues during the seasons of the year when that seems to be more of a problem, and we feel as though it's helpful, and worth the small cost and hassle in using it.
I have asthma since young and after trying this tea...I felt that I am able to breathe better... Will try To drink more and see whether I will have lesser recurrence.
summary: Really helpful for ppl who wish to breathe better

reviewText: I have mild, allergy-induced asthma. By comparison to many, I'm lucky, my symptoms tend to involve a mild tightening of the chest, coughing, and shortness of breath. I am not on any medications because it is mild and allergy-triggered. Any time I feel the tightness, I fix a cup of this tea, and add honey to sweeten it, and it helps quickly by loosening the tightening, and easing the cough. Very good stuff, worth a try, but always a good idea to check with your doctor, first.

As soon as I take a sip or two I can feel a sort of wash and openness in my lungs.  Definitely causes one to "breathe easy."  Have a hot tea or add a tea bag or two to your iced tea bags.  Very healthy stuff in there.

Traditional Medicinals Breathe Easy, 16-Count Boxes (Pack of 6)The product was delivered quickly, at the advertised price & same as what I pay more for at the retail store, especially with no shipping cost added on.
This tea is great and quite helpful to take when one experiences any respiratory issues.I find it very healing and it tastes good too.

Have been drinking this tea for years.  I used to get Bronchitis all the time and this was what helped me most with the coughing and congestion.  Even now, when I eat something that gives me mucus, this clears it up right away and I am able to sleep.

If my wife drinks a cup of this tea when she feels an attack coming on it often helps her avoid the attack at all. If we are out and she has an attack drinking this tea has lessened the effects and helped her recover more quickly.We have tried other tinctures and teas but his blend from TM has been wonderful! It tastes great (I enjoy it  myself) and it is an effective breathing aid.**of course this is not medical advice, this N1 experience.
summary: Lessens the effects of an asthma attack

reviewText: When I feel a breathing episode come on, I make some of this and can avoid using stronger medicines for it.

I purchased this to help me breathe easier while I'm jogging, since it am not very good and this helped so much! I am prone to asthma and a bit overweight (which is why I'm jogging). I'm definitely making part of my workout routine.

If you haven't tried this tea, PLEASE stop what you're doing and order it now.  It tastes ok, but it does WONDERS for stuffed/dry sinuses.  It's very soothing - great for sore throats or congestion....and it's MUCH better for you than NyQuill.
I love this product.  It works well for moderate to severe asthma sufferers!  I couldn't find this in the store anywhere.  The price is awesome for the product you get.

Honestly, I'm sure the tea works, don't really know. I have bronchiectasis and chronic asthma, yes... oh joy! So, I bought this, not really having much faith it'll work. But I guess it works, don't really know if it's this tea or my normal routine / slew of $550 a month of medications I take that's helping. But one thing I do know is that, I absolutely dislike the flavor, smell and aftertaste of this tea. It leaves a very odd aspertame (fake, cancerous sugar that used to be used as pesticide) on your tongue when you drink it. It's truly disgusting to me. Lots of good reviews on this tea and for the life of me, I can't figure out why as this tea tastes so nasty to me. To each his own! I guess if it works, it's all worth it.

Don't like synthetic pills?  Neither do I.  I drink a cup of Breathe Easy regularly during allergy season, particularly Cedar season in SW Texas, and it is as good as an antihistamine without the side effects (for us sensitive folk).  Local grocery store couldn't keep in stock, so I got this pack of 6 for cheaper per box than the grocery (and that was not a natural grocer either).  My teens love it too!

I purchased this product recently for my teenaged son's recurring asthma--imagine my delight and relief with finally finding something herbal that not only works but works rapidly!  This tea is quick and easy to prepare, relieves chest constriction, opens up the airways, and clears up my son's wheezing. Thank you, Traditional Medicinals, for keeping us out of the doctor's office and steroid free!

It is the best natural way to relieve congestion of the sinuses. It has a mild sweet flavor and taken warm/hot sets great in the body. I have been using this for 2 years and now even my family use it, all very satisfied.

I don't know about the medicinal aspects of this tea, but the flavor is downright scrumptious.  I love licorice root but have high blood pressure, so I'm not guzzling down box after box each week.  A few cups a week doesn't touch my BP, so I keep it to that.  The directions say to steep it for 10-15 minutes, but I'm far too impatient for that.  4-6 minutes is all I can wait after smelling that lovely aroma.  Traditional Medicinals puts out some really good teas.  I just wish they weren't so proud of 'em.  ChaChing!  Thanks, TM. Now try to work on that pricing for us, will ya?  Danke.

I've been battling a sinus infection and a cold for over a week now. I was told by a friend that Traditional Medicinals Tea was the way to go. I purchased this and the Gypsy Cold version and it's the first time that I've been able to sleep through the night without being woken up by not being able to breathe through my nose. I honestly don't think I will ever buy anything else again. Two thumbs up.
I love the taste of this tea and while it doesn't cure my asthma, it definitely helps while I drink it.  Highly recommend!  Getting the 6 pack its really convenient
I have asthma and I believe this tea to be of benefit...the ingredients contain many of the herbs which are recommended for better breathing
I have this every night. The bags hold strong. The flavor is consistent box to box time to time. They stay fresh in the packaging. I'm going to make some right now.

The taste of the breathe easy was ok, a little on the earthy side. I did find it cleared my lungs. However, I am prone to migraines and this set off a big one. I had to toss the 6 boxes I bought, ugh.

I have been battling a Sever Sinus/allergy actual infectio since 9/12/12...a couple more days and it will be narly 3 weeks.  I have been on acould antibotics that started to help, but alas to no avail.  Thank the Lord my dr. Had samples today of what I used to take as it was VERY expensive (no ins right now).  The tea is grea warm and is helping a great deal for the in between times.  Warm is the best but u can make a small pot of it & I add sugar and then stick it the fridge to go with me other places.  It feels wonnderful & the effects last a good long while.
summary: Wonderful for sore mouth & sore throat

reviewText: We have been using this tea during cold and flu season for many years now. I first found it in the grocery store, but they no longer carry it, so I have to get it here now. The flavor is good, even my children will ask for it when they are not feeling well. It definitely helps to ease symptoms of a head cold.
summary: This is the go to stuff at our house

reviewText: I have a lung condition and drink this every morning.  It does take a while to aquire the taste of the tea.
If you need to breathe easier drink this! As a singer I am always looking for homeopathic options....this is a great one...
Like the taste and the easy breathing after steeping this blend at least 10 minutes.  Definitely recommend the brand and this particular product.

So I couldn't find any in the store so I went to amazon and found this brand that is different from the kind I've had before but I could only order 6 boxes of 16 count and didn't want that much but really needed it so I ordered and let me tell ya I'm glad I did this stuff is awesome I got it I want to say over a year ago and I still have a few boxes but I'm going to need some more soon I just love how it sooths your throat I think the best way to prep it is with boiling water honey and milk it is great when you're sick or just need to relax I recommend it to anyone that likes eucalyptus and tea herbals are the best when you're sick and eucalyptus is great for congestion hope this helps
It opens nasal passages very quickly.  It also eliminates seasonal allergy symptoms.  Amazing!
This is my favorite tea, and buying the 6 pack was a great value compared to purchasing at a health food store.  No sweetener is required, thanks to the licorice root and it is simply delicious!
This tea is a taste you have to acquire, but its medicinal quality works to help my lungs open up so I can breathe better when they become congested.

Seems like they may be charging an arm and a leg for some menthol and few weeds... But I do have winter asthma and I find this tea to be helpful. It's nowhere near as good as getting a lung transplant from an unlucky twenty-year-old, but it does provide relief.I'm also okay with the taste, but that's a very personal decision that you'll need to decide for yourself. I've tried the Yogi version--compared them back to back--and I like this one better. (As for the throat-coat teas, I prefer the Yogi version.) However, I'd encourage you to try both brands and see which--if either--works for you. Given that you'll be stuck with six packages of this if you don't like it, I think it's wise to pay more and get a single box to try first. You can probably find it in the health food aisle at the larger supermarkets. But if you do find you like it, the per-box price in this six pack is the best I've seen.
My wife has problems with breathing, this products helps her relax and breathe better.Great price, Great product. Will be ordering more
I use a lot of this tea when having breathing troubles.  It's not as effective as some prescription meds but does feel good and seems to help and also tastes good.
This tea is very helpful when experiencing congestion due to a cold or asthma. Use with honey and lemon can increase theEffectiveness of this tea.
One night my asthma was bothering me so I brewed a cup. Not crazy about the flavor but can overlook it since it works!
summary: Works much better than it tastes

reviewText: This product is Awesome and Helpful for anyone with asthma and or breathing difficulties. I have dealt with for years and keep coming back to this item; because it seems to work so good with honey -and sometimes a drop or two of fresh lemon.  I add chamomile tea bag with one of these at bed time; and it really works very good for my lungs seem to be eased.  I do notice though that if the product is close to expiring it does not seem to be as effective-and would advise not buying anything near expired when it comes to all-nature products that probably don't have all that many additives or preservatives to begin with.
summary: Mainstay for anyone with breathing or allergy issues...

reviewText: I have low level Asthma (no drugs needed) but living in a city with horrible air and humidity is sometimes a problem.  I use the tea 2 bags at a time in the morning and find it to be very helpful in keeping my lungs clearer and functioning.  This is only needed in hot weather.Also love the savings on Amazon along with having them delivered.I will continue to use and recommend this product.
Don't waste your money buying this product. This will not help to breathe easy or get relief from allergies. It is just a lie.
summary: I think this product is a scam

reviewText: I have allergy-induced asthma. Perhaps this particular type is not affected by tea, because I see no change. However, this is my favorite tea ever. I have many tea-boxes that sit in my cabinets for years. This box lasts for a month before I have to replace. Anise/licorice root is wonderful!
This Tea really works My mother drinks it 2 times a dayThis Tea really works My mother drinks it 2 times a day

I had TB when I lived in Mexico in l970/71/72.  I used eucalyptus/licorice tea and actually cured myself.  Since that time, I have used this tea every day as I love the taste of it.  I recommend it to anyone who wants to strengthen their lungs.

This works very well to keep my lungs breathing easily.  Since I like the taste of licorice, this tastes good to me.  I drink this every morning during allergy season or when I have been exposed to mold and mildew.  I've used this product for over 15 years, and still prefer it over other choices (despite the formula change when ephedra was removed).  I am an acupuncturist and Chinese Herbalist, and find this an inexpensive way to take Bi Yan Pian (which is in the tea).
summary: This keeps my lungs open through allergy season

reviewText: Great tea for sinus issues and easing cold symptoms. Good tasting and needs no sweetening. My kids love it anytime.
summary: Our favorite tea when we get sick!

reviewerName: these pretzels r making me thirsty
reviewText: Traditional Medicinals is the best tasting herbal tea out there that I have tried. I have tried the Yogi teas before and did not care for them. I bought the Traditionals Breathe Easy and the Gypsy Cold Care. I take the breathe easy whenever I feel congested or like now when I had a coughing attack from some scent. My throat felt irritated and my chest felt achey and wheezy. Brewed a cup of this tea with some honey and it was so delicious and soothing. I don't know if its the way it makes you feel when you drink it because it tastes so good, or if the herbs really do help but I do feel better, a sense of calm. I highly recommend the Breathe Easy and the Gypsy Cold Care.
This is a great tea. Flavor is good, works well, priced right and fast shipping. If you like herbal teas, try it, you'll like it.
After being introduced to this brand of tea I found myself hooked and has been using it religiously.
not good at all. tase not good dose not help at all big time wast of mony dont order it

The product works great and we bought a box of them for $.01 each I think.  We bought 30 boxes and shipping was around $30 but 30 boxes will last a year since you get a total of 360 strips.  If you buy this product in the store they are around $10 a box so this price was a steal.  I should have bought a 2 year supply on Amazon for this price. No complaints and the product works great.  My husband wears one every night to help him breath better.

I have tested the Breathe Right Spray earlier but it wasn't solved my problem, snoring while asleep!The same product, Breathe Right Spray was a fair solution for a friend of mine when I gave him a bottle to try it. So I'm the unlucky one!Then I started thinking about the Nasal Strip to help me stop snoring if my snore comes out from my nose then I used it one time but was very disappointed. It wasn't worked out!So I figured out that the source of my snore is my throat not my nose but the Spray is not good enough to stop it.Anyway I found the Nasal Strip very useful for me not for snore-stop but to breathe right in a really enjoyable way. It was a good experience I have never had before!I most recommend this product for anybody who has any of his/her two nose's chambers blocked for some reason to use it all the time specially for the time you do sport or are asleep.It's a perfect item to breathe right!
summary: Perfect product even when you are not sleeping.

reviewText: Frankly I'm surprised it works but it does.  I slept without waking up every 15 to 30 minutes to blow my nose; I actually got some sleep.  I purchased the cheapest version as I wanted to test it and I hope the other, more expensive versions, are stronger, that's why I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 stars, but yes it did actually worked for me.

Same exact product is sold at Walmart for 99cents. Not worth buying it on Amazon, you should buy this somewhere else!The product itself is pretty nice, the nail clippers are fast and cut hangnails, fingernails, etc. easily. It's a good product but Amazon is ripping you off by charging the price they're charging!

The W. E. Bassett Company has always been America's premier and chief manufacturer of manicure implements. Their famous manicure implements have been marketed under the TRIM name for over 50 years. This Trim Family Manicure Kit has been around for some time and has been a popular item for years. And why not!?  You get a Fingernail Clipper, a Toenail Clipper, Tweezers, a Cuticle Stick and an Emery Board with fine and coarse grit sides for shaping and finishing. This is an outstanding quality product at extraordinarily economical pricing.
summary: Economical Family Manicure Kit by Trim

reviewText: Great kit for everyday nail care. The nail clippers provide a clean cut with no sharp edges. The tweezers are solid metal with a great edge to grasp onto anything.

I ordered this to provide replacements for my current Trims.  However, the trimmers in this set are missing the nail files.  This is evident in the small picture if you look very carefully, which I obviously failed to do.  If you do not care about the files, this is a good deal.  But if you do, don't buy this item as you will be (as I am) disappointed.  Annoyingly, the complete versions of the trimmers are not sold in a set and are usually marked up to an excessive degree.

I really enjoy PowerBar ProteinPlus bars - but rarely buy them except when they are on sale. Purchasing them through Amazon is like having a sale everyday. I used the subscription for these PowerBars and reduced the cost even more. I have also purchased 2 other flavors.  The Toffee Nut arrived the quickest. I have many food sensitivities, and these products do not trigger them.  I feel vey happy to have them.
summary: Dark Chocolate Toffee Nut - fantastic flavor! Great Amazon prices

reviewText: These bars are delicious and significantly cheaper than buying in stores. Heavy bar, like for a meal. Tastes good. Good value.

These are my new favorite protein bars. I've struggled a lot with getting enough protein in my diet, but I typically find protein bars to be way too dry, with a weird aftertaste. This bar is great! It is super moist, tastes fine (I wish it was a little more peanut buttery tasting), and no weird aftertaste. It can be a full meal replacement given the calories/protein for those of us with lower caloric needs, so I usually eat half. Definitely tops my old favorite protein bars (Luna - which are fine, but less good than this).

Great tasting protein bar providing the an easy filler before or after workouts.  As well as tasting good the bar provides 23 grams of protein and although it tastes good it doesn't contain too much sugar.  What is more the bar is easily digestible and doesn't need to be consumed with litres of water. Highly recommend this bar.

Pros+Has more protein than your average bar (23g)+has a huge load of essential vitamins and nutrients, with many meeting your daily value needsCons-Sugar content is pretty high(19g)-hardly any dietary fiber is a let down(1g)I recently bought the vanilla yogurt bars 24 pack from ebay, and I think they taste great(very chewy) and are nutritious. I wasn't expecting these bars to have so many 100% daily values of important vitamins, and I personally don't think I need all that, since I get most of them from my cereal (such as from Total). The amount of protein (23 grams of course) are great, and the calories and saturated fat are slightly higher than your average protein bar (but if you're serious about gaining weight from weight training, it doesn't matter), but that never really worried me--even though I am controlling my calories to lose weight with running and weight lifting.I'm disappointed though on the amount of sugar and lack of dietary fiber it has. 19g is a bit high for me, and 1g is just low. Many of their competitors have 4X the amount of dietary fiber, and a bit less sugar--though this bar does have more protein than your average bar. I know the sugar is needed to help make it taste great, but even I can personally feel its kick, and I would be better off with half the content.I wouldn't mind opting for the reduced sugar variant, but those are  a bit more expensive, and has 26g of sugar alcohol of who knows what.I don't know if I'll ever buy these powerbar proteins again, after I'm done with my 24 pack, since these bars do have a lot of sugar. But if the makers of powerbar manage to cut the sugar content by at least half or even a quarter, and have a little more fiber, I'd buy them regularly!

I love these bars they taste great before and after a work out.I recommend anyone that is working out constintaly or even everyday to eat one of these bars 30 min to an hour before your work out and while you eat a bar make sure you are constintaly drinking water.ENJOY! =)
summary: five stars for the protien bars

reviewText: This is a reasonably good enough power bar for those times when you can't eat a real meal.  Good texture and satisfying.
These energy bars are excellent.  They taste great and really give me a boost when I am cycling and are a great protein snack after a good workout.

These energy bars are excellent.  They taste great and really give me a boost when I am cycling and are a great protein snack after a good workout.  The Cookies and Cream flavor is my favorite so far.  I would recommend that you drink plenty of water when eating one of these bars.
I've had several protein bars, & this is probably my least favorite. It's not terrible, but, to me, it is very dry & has minimal peanut butter flavor.

I am a power bar addict and I absolutely LOVE this one... However, the vanilla flavor adds to (rather than takes away from...) the typically "cardboard" flavor of a Power Bar.  Oddly enough, this doesn't bother me!  The vanilla is so sweet (and I am an admitted sugar addict) that it really does control that need for snacking.  I usually split the bar... one half before my workout and one half after.  I do agree that you MUST have water with one of these bars.  It will sit like a ton of bricks in your stomach without the water.  All in all, this bar is great.  I can easily get through a long day or a tough workout with one of these.
The new and "improved" Protein Plus PowerBars are much drier than they were before though they are easier to chew (as advertised).  Plus one gram less of protein than before.

Good value.  These are not wimpy little bars.  Carb count is a little higher than I'd like but they taste great.  I eat half at a time.  Save the other half for a snack later.  The chocolate coating tastes like chocolate, not some grainy reproduction.  You won't be disappointed.  Amazon did a great job getting them to me fast.  No problem there.  They're the best.
Unlike other power bars, this one isn't dense and tastes decently well. The filling is more aerated (think of what you find in a milky way bar). Good amount of protein and reasonably priced.

It is great to have a tasty Protein Bar that gives a lot of protein (for us advance muscle building fitness folks)with minimal fat.  I've always liked Power Bar products but this one provides the most efficient balance for the money.

I bought one of these (chocolate peanut butter) at 7-11 to try it out. First bite taste was okay, but by the time I finished the bar, I was left with a really gross aftertaste, almost chemical-like. I won't be buying any more.
summary: Try one before committing to a box

reviewText: Great ontime delivery, delivered what they said. The bar tastes great - the perfect breakfast!
transaction was fast and the product was fresh and in great shape upon arrival.

If I eat one of these bars at 7:30 am after a workout, I am not hungry until lunch, or around 11 AM.  The bars taste fine, and if eaten with some kind of drink, won't sit heavily in your stomach.  Good Stuff.
I hate the way it taste... I got the choco crisp one and it tastes very artificial; I definitely suggest you not to get that flavor...

I've tried many protein bars over the last two years and the Chocolate Peanut Butter flavored ProteinPlus Power Bars are definately the best I've had.I started out eating the EAS AdvantEdge Carb Control Nutrition Bars (http://www.amazon.com/exec/obidos/tg/detail/-/B00007L64I/sr=1-4/qid=1129724511/ref=sr_1_4/104-3189383-4115126?%5Fencoding=UTF8&n;=3760931&s;=hpc&v;=glance) a while back during the Atkins craze. (I replaced my Pop-Tart breakfast with low-carb bars.)  I liked them a lot until one day EAS decided to make their bars "better" by adding "goo" to their bars.  The chocolate chip brownie and peanut butter bars, once staples in my morning diet, had fallen from grace.Now I buy boxes of ProteinPlus Power Bars (12 bar variety pack) from Sam's club ($14 and change), and the Chocolate Peanut Butter flavored are definately the best.  I came to Amazon looking to see if I could get boxes of just this flavor.  I also buy Snickers Marathon bars, which are glorified candy bars, and the Peanut Butter power bars are definately in the same flavor league as the Snickers bars.The Cookies and Cream flavor are also good, but the Vanilla Yogurt flavor don't do much for me (thus the peanut butter only search).
summary: Best tasting protein bar I've had.

reviewText: These are the best tasting protein bars I've ever had. They are my favorite. I have been buying them for years and I still like them. They are a great way to get some protein and energy quick. Especially when you are building muscle.
The protein bar is a good source of protein however i chose to switch to detour bar because i get more protein per bar.  Its a better meal substitution.
I like the way these taste. As compared to some power bars these don't have such a play doh taste.

Everyone needs an extra boost of energy after exercise, and this good tasting bar provides just that.All the necessary nutrients are there to give you the lift you need.It is helpful to drink a tall glass of water along with it.
summary: TASTES GOOD AND IS GOOD FOR YOU

reviewText: Sorry, I was not a fan of these bars. The purchase and the shipping was great, but I didn't like the taste. Try it in the store first before you buy a whole box.

Perhaps I just got a bad batch, but...it's a real pain to rely on a convenience food for quick nutrition in a fast lifestyle that winds up dropping flakes of chocolate coating all over the place. At almost $2 a bar, this is inexcusable.

I've tried many protein bars but this is the only one that i like for extra energy and sometimes as my cookie/sweet.  The downfall of this bar is that it gets really sweet and having too many in one day or in one week can really get you sick of the bar and you wouldn't want to eat it anymore.  Other than that this is the only bar that doesn't just have chocolate or peanut butter flavoring, which makes it unique at the same time not taste like a protein bar!

I have used the Chocolate PowerBar from a grocery and think it is a great product: highly recommended. The carton of them I got through the mail are basically OK, but seem to be slightly stale, a problem not encountered with the grocery-store purchases.

I've been trying a lot of different protein bars to eat after working out and most of them taste nasty.  I like the power bar energy bars too, but they don't taste that well and I think you burn off 20 calories just chewing those things.These bars are much better than those as they aren't like chewing a rawhide dog toy.  The flavor is really good and I'm impressed by the good balance between high protein, low calories and fat grams.  Taste aside other bars have higher calories or fat with equal or fewer protein.
summary: nice balance between taste, protein, calories and fat grams

reviewText: Very good! When I feel hungry in the morning when I'm either at work or at home, I'll unwrap one PowerBar and I feel fine after I eat it until late afternoon when I have a little lunch. I would recommend it to anyone.

Came nicely packaged and on time.  Aren't expired, taste just fine, and were cheaper than buying them from your local grocery store.  Only complaint is that the chocolate was melted when they arrived, but I live in Arizona, so it comes with the territory.

I gave it 3 stars because I went into trying it the first time assuming to expect it to be less good than I wanted. If I had known nothing about Protein Bars prior I would be giving this 2 stars.  First off, I don't know if I like the taste, I mean it's not bad by any means, but the texture makes me unable to figure out if I like the flavor.  They're chewy, and not in a good way. The taste besides that isn't spectacular, if the other reviews on here are any indication of what's a good protein bar and what's not. I don't think I'm cut out to eat these on a daily basis.  The texture made it seem almost stale, I checked the date and no it's not expired.  The Peanut Butter taste wasn't strong and not really that good.  The chocolate was decent but kind of weak,  with that said I bought it figuring as much so my expectations were low. I didn't think it was going to be delicious like a candy bar. It is packed as hell with protein and vitamins.  And I didn't choke on it.  I suppose this is something you eat when you want to get in better shape. If only Reces Peanut Butter Cups were as good for you as these *siiiigh* but I digress. I would have preferred a consistency that resembled human food. A  point in their favor, I'm a dude who can EAT, and this did a very commendable job of making me feel like I'd eaten something of substance. It's very dense and that's good. I worked out 10-15 minutes after eating it. I don't know if it helped at all, but protein is good so I'm assuming it did.  I want to try the Cliff Bars, reviews on here claim they mimic actual food, which I think I'd like.I just can't get over the chewiness, maybe if I ate them on a regular basis my mouth and mind could adjust to the alien like texture.  For all it provided though I'd recommend them, just don't expect a Hershey Bar delicious dessert treat.  YMMV I'm sure some people love them - well they must I read some shining reviews.

This very high protein bar tastes good, and does wonders in filling you up. For me, it is an excellent quick lunch and has helped with my weight management. It has a pleasant-enough taste (my kids don't like it, but they want a 'candy bar', not a 'power bar'!). I have been very pleased with this product, and intend to continue to purchase them. I think you will be pleased as well, especially if you have a sweet-tooth and are looking for a meal replacement that works.

PowerBar ProteinPlus High Protein Bar, Chocolate Peanut Butter, 2.75-Ounce Bars (Pack of 12)I'm a big fan of energy bars and I would have to say Powerbar Protein Plus Bars in Chocolate Peanut Butter are one of the best! Tastes great, satisfying, gives you long-lasting energy and 23g of protein to help you build those lean muscles.
summary: great before and/or after a good workout

reviewText: I wanted some extra protein for my workouts. Saw these on a gold box special at a great price and I bought them. I really don't like the taste, compared to other high protein bars I have tried, but they had great nutritional benefits. I would not buy these again though, due to the taste for me.
summary: Not very tasty, but good protein content

reviewText: these are great as 1 of the 5 small meals a day that are required.  they are like eating a candy bar but good for you.
This helps me get thru my day when i can't get a bite to eat. It gives me the energy i need.

The powerbar has become a staple in our house. Cookies and Cream along with Chocolate Crisp are our favorites. Our 2 boys grab these as a snack rather than a pop tart and as a quick breakfast. They eat powerbars before a work out then eat a regular meal afterwords. They love the taste!
I love the chewiness and the texture of these powerbars! They really taste like a candy bar and they're very healthy. I don't like the reduced sugar version though.
I was a fan of the old version of this product as emergency food, but they changed it.  Now it's mealy and more cardboard-tasting than before.

Calcium is good but not in large amounts. 40% calcium is too much; in fact I'd prefer 0% because I already eat natural healthy foods. If you drink a lot of milk you may need to take this into consideration before purchasing this.

Finally a power bar as a main course.  After a huge workout, it is very important to eat something stacked with protein within the hour.  This bar is perfect for that.  Before, I would munch down the slim power bar and choke down a can of tuna.  Tuna can have high mercury levels.  I can avoid this with the PowerBar ProteinPlus.
This is a delicious and filling energy bar  I take one with me when I play golf and it provides me the stamina I need to finish 18 holes.

We have the auto-order set up, on Amazon, and it's less expensive even than local sale prices.  We eat these bars often as a breakfast on the go - they fill you up until lunch or later.  This is my husband's favorite flavor, I prefer the chocolate peanut butter.  Higher i size and therefore calories than some of the other bars, but it does the job if you're hungry and don't feel like sitting down for a meal.

I was looking for something I could take with me on the road so I wouldn't starve between school and work and found this bar. I initially tried it because it was on sale but ended up continuing a Subscribe & Save subscription because it fit the bill nicely. A little sweeter than I would prefer, but it's got a ton of protein and really fills you up between meals.
I am not a huge fan of the protein bar simply because of the flavor, but this one (PowerBar Vanilla Yogurt) is actually really good.
The item I received was their new 'Vanilla' PowerBar ProteinPlus.  The Vanilla Yogurt bars are being discontinued. I did not enjoy these new bars very much.  They are much too sweet for my taste.

Protein Bar, Vanilla Yogurt is my favourite energy bar.  I eat it after a workout or a run.  It tastes good, it takes time to eat (which is good!) and gives a fullness sensation.  I particularly like the high protein concentration as opposed to other bars that have more of a carbohyrates emphasis.  The pack of 12 lasts me two to four weeks and is a good bang for the buck.

i love these bars soooo much!! i am hooked!! i love them so much that i signed up for subscribe and save with amazon so i can get the bars delivered one a month (or usually twice a month).  i usually eat these before or after a workout.  they satisfy my hunger.  they are a perfect high protein snack.  the only thing i noticed is that they are a tad high in saturated fat so i try to eat these once every other day.  they do not leave a gross aftertaste like some protein bars.  the flavor is amazing, I've tried the chocolate and the chocolate peanut butter and the vanilla yogurt are still my favorite!! great buy and great price!!
Very addictive. I'm surprised at how much I love this one. And yes, the previous reviewer is right, it gives you the full sensation, which is great so I can skip a meal or two after I eat it.
summary: It Even Tastes Better than Those Full-Fat Chocolate Candy Bars!

reviewText: Never received the item. I ordered a pack of chocolate peanut butter power bars through amazon and was very disappointed. I will think twice before ordering items again. Hope this is helpful.

These boxes of power bars expire 12/21/2011.  As a result they taste somewhat stale.  The reason why I buy this particular flavor is due to the taste.  I recommend you don't sell any more bars whose expiration date is within 6 months.

I had enjoyed these bars for many years, but the formula has changed.  Both the texture and taste are significantly different.  Some people may like the change but I do not and will no longer purchase this flavor bar.

I purchased these protein bars to save money from the price I normally pay for them.  They came from Amazon and not a third party seller.  This was my first time ordering from Amazon and was disappointed in this item only!  Unfortunately, they were extremely stale.  I looked at the expiration date on the product and it was fine, however, I think these items were frozen and thawed out or they sat in a very warm area of a warehouse and dried out beyond tastefullness!  I had a few other people who always eat these try them and they said they were not good AT ALL!  I will not order food type items from you again, but will definitely keep shopping at Amazon.com.  It's great otherwise!  Keep up the good work on your prices, items and service.  I would take a look at your food storage though.

I like these nutrition packed bars, but this shipment which just arrived 1/2 hour ago, had flap of Power Bar box partly opened and one bar was missing.There were only 11 bars in carton.  I would like a replacement for that missing bar, or a credit to my account for it's value.  ThanksPowerBar ProteinPlus High Protein Bar, Vanilla Yogurt, 2.75-Ounce Bars (Pack of 12)PLease advise how you will correct this.
summary: One Power Bar missing from carton

reviewText: I eat a power bar protein plus every morning before I row. I've got a 20 minute commute to the boathouse and the power bar along with a jug of water and I am ready for an intense work out.  Additionally, I eat these as an alternative to a cookie or some other high fat, high carb snack during the day. These bars taste good, are packed with the right stuff and get you over those cravings and down points that we all experience from time to time. Grab a box and keep them on hand, you'll be happy you've got them nearby when your hungry.  Highly recommend this product.
Not so hot a bar.  Have tried different flavors of the same.  Slight chalky taste.  Just in general, I don't think they have near the taste of something like Clif Bar Builder's Bars.

I have added one of these to my morning routine.  I used to just drink a quart of water for breakfast,(over about an hour and a half).  I started eating one of these along with the water and I feel more energetic while getting ready for work.  I buy three boxes ervery two months using the subscription method.  Amazon sends a heads up email to you before shipping the subscribed items alowing you to add to or stop any shipments at your leisure.

I love having one of these in my backpack or purse as a back-up pick-me up that isn't overloaded with sugar, sodium or artificial sweeteners. I'm deathly allergic to Splenda (secretly added to many things today under the chemical name of sucralose), so I always check labels. Most energy bars are not high enough in protein, or are either overly sweet, overly salty or worse - overly bland. I don't have the sensation that I'm eating cardboard covered in flavoring. Unlike a lot of protein bars out there, I really have a sensation of being full after having one, instead of trying to find something else to snack on. I'm one of those rare birds that hates chocolate, so it's hard enough to find an option that is not dripping in the brown stuff. Rest assured, chocolate lovers, PowerBar does make chocolate flavored bars - but I very much appreciate having the vanilla yogurt bar as an option for protein. It isn't overly crunchy, so I don't get flecks of particles all over my shirt when I grab one on the go - and I don't get stuff stuck between my teeth eating these, either - so it's safe to have before a staff meeting.

I bought these for my granddaughter to eat as she ran from one practice to another.She really liked the flavor but wants to try another next time. I signed up for delivery every 2 months for the discount.

I am a runner and discovered this in a grocery store when I was at the four mile mark of a ten mile run and stopped for some water. This tastes great, and gives me plenty of energy when I run or work out in the gym. I also keep this at work for a snack.
This bar is a regular item in our cabinet at home, and at our desks at work.
summary: Doesn't taste like a protein bar

reviewText: This product contains large amounts of sugar alcohol as 'maltitol syrup'.  This is not disclosed on the nutrition label, and is omitted completely from the list of ingredients shown on the Amazon.com site, even though it appears on the bar ingredents label.If you have a bad reaction to the laxative maltitol beware, you will get very sick eating this product.

Amazon offeres one of the better box prices for these protein bars.  The chocolate peanut butter tastes pretty good(although I don't like them as well directly after hard workouts, but thats prob. just me).  They have a good amount of protein and make a good pre-workout snack as well.
The flavor is great but the texture is a little grainy.  If this doesn't bother you they are perfect.
It's a very good tasting bar with 23gms of protein, but is rather pricey.  I prefer the Clif Protein Bars which have 20gms of protein and cost much less.
summary: Good bar but are better choices

reviewText: I am always willing to try new workout supplements and techniques.  I was kind of wary of buying these, mainly because Power Bar is kind of a cliché (shallow, I know).  However, I got a box of 12 for about 15 bucks (on sale) from Amazon, and let me tell you I wasn't disappointed.First off, these similar bars I have seen in stores for 3 bucks a bar.  So already the price of $1.25 per was very appealing.Secondly, these things have a LOT of protein and carbs in them for protein bars (23g).  Similar ones at health food stores usually have 15-18g.Thirdly, and something I wasn't expecting, is these things actually take the edge off your hunger.  I am one of those people that have a high metabolism and is ALWAYS hungry.  When eating these in the morning (I take mass gainers at night, and wanted something high protein as a morning snack) I actually feel satisfied for a couple hours, which never happens.-----Summary:  It's a really good deal if you can get them cheap.  Cheaper than other protein supplements, and actually take the edge off hunger.  I will be purchasing these again.-----Pro Tip:  Different flavors cost different amounts.  I got the Cookies and Cream 12 pk for around 15 bucks, but the chocolate peanut butter were 25 (which I did not purchase).  Let's be honest.  These are protein bars.  They won't be really delicious.  I didn't expect them to be.  So just at the top of the Amazon page, pick the one that is priced the least, as they all have the same nutrition.

I've tasted all the flavors and I prefer the chocolate covered peanut butter bar the most. My Least favorate is the vanilla yogurt. These bars have gone up in price a bit the last few years as with all other food stuffs. I used to be able to get them at the local Walmart store for $12 to $14 a box then they stopped carying them.I'll take a moment and compare this bar to the Met-Rx protein bars.Different flavors may vary:As this bar stands it has approximately 38grams of Carbs of which 21grams are simple sugars (not good). This differs from say a Met-Rx protein bar in that it has 13grams of Carbs with only 2grams being simple sugars. On the positive side the Met-Rx protein bar has 250 total Calories with 80 Cals from fat and all being of the saturated type. The protein Plus bar has approximately 290 Calories with 45 Calories being fat and only 2.5grams being saturated. I also recommend that one look at Sodium and Cholesterol content when selecting supplement bars. The Met-rx Protein bar has 10mg of Cholesterol and the Powerbar has 5mg. Both bars are comparible on sodium content.You be the judge.Hope this helped.J. Tesi, Ph.D. Human Performance.

These bars are very good! We feed them to our picky eating kids for extra protein. Our only issue was that Amazon took a full month to deliver them. No apologies or anything. We just hung in limbo for a month for the product to be delivered. My advice would be to buy the product but buy it from somewhere besides Amazon.William Shouse
summary: Product is Tasty!  Delivery From Amazon is Sour!

reviewText: Arrived as fast as light exAmazon.This flavor ain't available with my local candy store steps from my most humble abode. Right in my luxury building.Opened the package with the smile on the box to find these PowerBars.Tried this Chocolate Crisp PowerBar immediately. Found it to be tasty, fresh as can be and very pleasant. Not only is it pleasant tasting it is packed with every vitamin and mineral known to mankind and many 100% of the RDA. The candy bar doesn't have artificial sweeteners that can be dangerous (almost went blind on aspartame and sucrolose is no solution)The candy, again is very tasty and fresh with only 290 calories for a bar, twice as big as most candy bars with only 50 fat calories. Geez! Most candy bars have over 100 fat calories per bar and weigh 50% less.I wholeheartedly recommend this PowerBar Chocolate Crisp.
I usally dont care about taste that much but oh my god this thing is SO FREAKIN SWEET that it makes me nauseous and it only has 23g protein. I returned them
Tastes great. A little sweet and lower in protein than Think Bars, but this bar is good!

Updated review on 06/23/2013 which is now only 2 stars:OMG, why in the heck did they change their recipe? The chocolate fudge brownie bar that I once was addicted to is no more. What they now sell as "Chocolate Fudge Brownie" are so hard now, the bars can serve as a door stop or as another reviewer wrote, as a brick. Yes, and the taste has changed for the worst.
