Why did they change something that wasn't broken is beyond me. I still order these, but to be able to tolerate the taste, I put a Oskri Coconut Bar on top, cut the bars in half, and then eat the 2 bars together, but it's half of both to keep the caloric amount the same. I actually enjoy it this way, but still am disappointed by the hardness of the Genisoy bar. The Oskri Coconut Bar is so soft (and yummy) that it helps mask the hardness of the Genisoy Chocolate Fudge Brownie Bar.All I can say is "Genisoy, please fire the idiot who convinced you that this new formula is better and go back to the old recipe to win back your faithful customers."In comparison, I kept my old review so those of you who are wondering what we are talking about as far as this change is concerned can understand the issue better.Old Review from 2/10/2012 which was 5 stars: Title was "I could become an addict"I went searching high and low for a replacement chocolate brownie bar when my taste for Clif chocolate brownie bar suddenly changed (I had no other taste changes for any other food and the manufacturer swore they made no changes). I bought one of every type of chocolate protein bar and literally Genisoy was the last one I had to taste. I've had Luna bars and don't like their taste at all. My first byte into the Genisoy chocolate brownie had an after taste of vitamins, but after the first bar, that taste was gone. It was delicious and I love the fudgey, soft texture. I had finally found my replacement protein chocolate bar after weeks of searching all the local organic markets.
summary: 6/23/2013: Update to old review... What the heck were they thinking?!?!

reviewText: Genisoy bars are a great meal replacement.  They are more filling than any other bar we have tried.  I would highly recommend them to friends and family.  In fact my daughter has also started buying them.
They are just delicious, and a great way to get in some protein if your day is turning out to be deficient in it.  A good emergency ration kind of thing.
The bars arrived as plan and are very fresh. I will difinitely order this product again on Amazon. Thanks again.

The Genisoy protein bars are thin, chewy protein bars. The chocolate fudge brownie is one of the best flavors from Genisoy. It does taste like soy but it is sweet enough to make you feel like you're eating a treat. The texture is similar to the original Power Bar but definitely tastes better.
bought these suckers a few months ago & have been hooked, love the taste & they're soy.by far this is my fav flavor.:)
These bars are soooooooooooooo good I eat too many of them! Great for meal replacements or snacks. But be warned, they are addicting!

I have no idea what all those people are saying but these bars don't taste that great...it is full of sugar and high fructose corn syrup. I much prefer luna bars or the south beach meal bars--which all taste tons better and are healthier.

I was excited to repurchased these bars after I took 2 years off from eating them. I have two children under 18 months old and was pregnant A LOT and the dr said to stay away from soy based products while pregnant. Anyway, when they arrived I was surprised that the packaging was different (not as shown here) and that the bar is a new recipe and shape. They are more square like a balance bar, a little less in calories (maybe by 10 or so) and the taste IS TERRIBLE!!! Almost the consistency of an Atkins bar or some other low carb tasting crap (even though these are not low carb) I only wish I read the one reviewer warning of this new taste before I bought these. What a waste of $13. :-(

I used to really like this product.  It kept me from getting hungry for at least 6 hours.However, this shipment seems to be melted and stuck to the wrapper.  Even though it is edible,it makes a mess just getting it out of the wrapper.  Maybe that is why I could no longer findit in the grocery stores.

At one time these bars were my favorite.  Tasty and soft.  Now they are suitable to be used as paving stones.  I have purchased from three or four different Amazon suppliers.  Each time the result has been the same - hard and unpleasant to chew.  I have stopped purchasing the Genisoy Chocolate Fudge Brownies and now purchase and eat Cliff Bars exclusively.  A shame, but life goes on.  Even without you Genisoy.
Pleasantly surprised how tasty these bars are!  They're chewy and moist and filling!  Love them and would definitely recommend them!

This used to be one of my favorite bars, but not any longer.  Earlier this year, think around the April 2012 time frame, they changed the "model" and made it a lot more "hard" and less tasty.  They used to be much softer and tastier.  In fact the last set of bars before they made this change were absolutely great and hence this change has been harder to take. Hope they change it back to what it used to be.

The bars are good, however seem to be very hard. Just a little too hard for my taste. They taste good and have good protein. I will try a different flavor next time I order. I would recommend to anyone that enjoys something very chewy.
summary: Very very chewy, and tastes good.

reviewText: The package was warm after being inside of a mail truck all day and thus the coating of chocolate melted.
summary: great product but difficult to purchase in the summer

reviewText: The reviewer below who states these have high fructose corn syrup is wrong.  I'm looking at the ingredients list for the Chocolate Fudge bar and it lists corn syrup, but not the notorious high fructose variety.  It's a good, tasty snack and a good way to get soy protein on the go.

Of all of the nutrition bars that I have tried the Genisoy Chocolate Fudge Brownie is right up there in the top 4.  It doesn't taste like a protein bar - it tastes almost like a candy bar.  When I have a chocolate craving this bar can really satisfy it.  Even my husband (who hates nutrition bars) likes these.

I love their wine saver product, and use that all the time; what a great gadget! And I drink a lot more coffee than wine, and am at least as sensitive to the quality, so this sounded pretty promising.  Unfortunately, I found it didn't work worth a darn. I was never able to get it to hold a seal satisfactorily, and so the whole effort of using this became a waste. Almost any container (ziploc, tupperware, mason jar, etc.) would be better.  Sorry to say that, because the idea has promise and I like their other product quite a bit. I would recommend not getting this, based on my experience.
We keep our coffee fresh after grinding. I keeps the freshness for 2 weeks with daily use.  GREAT

The Vacu Vin coffee saver refill has been a great addition to our kitchen.  We use it to now store a variety of specialty coffees that we may get to only once a week or so, and the beans are now lasting us for months instead of a few weeks.  We also have been using it to store some bulk spices.  We had been using a powered vacuum unit, but it took up too much counter space.  We already had been using the vacu vin system for our wines for years, and glad we finally stumbled onto the canisters.
summary: Keeping my coffee and spices fresh

reviewText: This product is great.  I only wish they made bigger storage containers.
This container really keeps my beans fresh. Just keep it in a cool dry, dark place and enjoy fresh coffee!

What I have learned from a few years of using Vacu Vin products is they work very well if you wet the lid seal and the stopper ribs and slit before pumping down. The pump also does better with a shot of water down the neck. I love these products and water makes them work. I am in the process of ordering more.
summary: Vacu Vin Coffee Very good if you know a few things

reviewText: I home roast my beans and the Vacuvin is the best way to preserve the fresh flavor and aroma I crave.  This is one of the best investments you can make if you are truly serious about your coffee!Purchase a wine kit or marinader to get the pump you need for the coffee containers.

Don't expect miracles.  It does create a vacuum which you can hear when you release the top but honestly I don't notice food lasting that much longer in these.  Also you really have to work hard to create the vacuum and I'm never sure how much I've done.  If you are obsessive compulsive you will be pumping away at these forever.
summary: does create a vacuum but food don't last much longer.

reviewText: This works better with beans than ground coffee, and I think the coffee stays fresher, but it's hard to tell after a week or two in any container. Ground coffee tends to break the seal and defeats the purpose of the vacuum. Washing the container out or using water to help keep the seal is a pain.I'm surprised no one else has come up with the idea of a vacuum-sealed or nitrogen-charged coffee container. It could be a very good idea.I also recommend buying two containers (holds one pound). You don't need the new pump if you have an existing Vacu-vin wine pump.

this canister really keeps the air out which means coffee stays fresh!  But remember do not keep in the refrigerator or else the seal becomes broken...I only wish this company would make different sizes and I would buy them all!

This is the only way to keep coffee beans fresh as when I brought them home. With a few easy pumps of the VacuVin hand vacumn pump (the same system as I use with the VacuVin wine storage system) the container seals and the air is evacuated. This maintains the beans in the same state as when the were purchased in vacume packed bags.
summary: An absolute must to store your fresh coffee beans!

reviewText: I have used the wine bottle system successfully for several years and love it.  So, I bought the marinade and coffee systems along with an extra canister for sugar.  Despite trying different stoppers and different degrees of vacuum (pumps), the coffee and sugar canister lids are always loose the next time I use it (a 24 hour interval or longer).  The seals are in place and seem fine.  Any help would be appreciated.
summary: Great concept, but I'm having trouble with it.

reviewText: I have never written an online review before, but I feel this one needs to get some positive feedback.  The product is great.  It does exactly what it promises.  I can keep coffee well over a month with no noticeble difference in quality.  It kills me that someone gave this two stars because it didn't come with the pump.  It never claimed to come with the pump.  It's a replacement canister, genius.  Hence, the name.  Once again, this is a great product.  Buy with confidence.

After using the wine savers, I was eager to try the canisters.  They do tend to come unsealed for some reason.  However, when they hold (more often than not) they do a wonderful job, and have saved me a lot of food that would have otherwise gone to waste.  I have kept rice cakes in these things for weeks, and they were as crisp as the day I opened the package.  I kept store-bought cookies in one for close to two months - again, not a bit stale.  I have noticed that any particles that adhere to the rubber seal or the rim of the canister seem to affect the seal, so I always check that no crumbs have stuck to either.  The water trick suggested by another reviewer sounds helpful.  My only concern there would be that that might introduce moisture into the canister.  However, I am going to give it a try.  All in all, these canisters are good.  The seal does occasionally fail, but when it holds, it is wonderful.  I am on this page because I am thinking of adding another to my set (I already have six canisters and two rectangular marinaters/containers, but I would use more if I had them).  BTW, the marinater does a wonderful job, and I've never had a problem with the seal while marinating (shorter time in use, perhaps?).  ...and it really does work fast!
summary: Not perfect, but still worth it.

reviewText: I have been using the cannister for 2 years with excellent results.  I use it to store a small supply of ground coffee, and am ordering a second cannister to store whole beans after I've opened the bag.I, too, experienced the "losing the vacuum seal" that some reviewers have noted.  In my case, I grind exceedingly fine, and if I allow some of the find-ground coffee up on the cannister sides where the seal fits, the seal will not hold.  I routinely just run my finger around the inside top of the cannister after adding new grounds to remove the thin dusting of coffee, and have not had the problem.  I do occasionally rinse the lid with water, but very rarely.  I highly recommend this product.
summary: Works very well, losing vacuum seal easily fixed

reviewText: I have been using it to keep coffee beans as well as the grounds. It woorkswell but you need the pump to create the seal between the lid and canister.

This is a wonderful storage system.  It uses the same pump as for the wine stopper.  I'll definitely buy more of the different sizes for things like pretzels and crackers.  Living in an area with lots of humidity it really helps keep things fresh.

I have been using this container withVacu Vin Wine Saver Blister Pack -1 Pump 1 Stopperto store coffee. The very next day I have noticed that the container was open. Sometimes using the pump excessively helps but again no longer then a day and definitely not two.

I have the Vacu Vin marinator and love it, so I bought the coffee saver thinking it would be just as good. It worked initially, but after three weeks of infrequent use I am quite disenchanted! The seal does not hold; I pump out the air and within an hour the air is back again. I'll still use it as a canister, but I would not buy any more. (I still love the marinator though...)

This has a 0.75 Liter (Vacu-Vin is based in the Netherlands) capacity.  The Vaccuum food saver comes with a 1.0 Liter, 0.75 Liter, and 0.5 Liter jar with pump.  The Vacuum Food Saver lid is white.  The Vacuum marinator (multi dish) is 1.25 Liter capacity.  The Concerto stoppers also work with the Vacuum coffee saver, the Concerto vacuum pump is easier to use and won't accidently crack the container by pumping too much.  The interior is 5 inches long with a 4 inch diameter.  While I haven't tried it as a marinator, my guess is that it would hold about a 1-1/2 pound circular Boston roast.  The Concerto pump won't work very well with the regular pump stoppers, so if you buy the Concerto pump, buy (extra) Concerto stoppers.
This product would taste fine if it didn't contain artificial sweetener.  This was a bit disappointing. I wish I could have read the ingredients, not just the nutritional label.

I drink low carb/high protein shakes for breakfast everyday - have done so for several years.  The Carb Solutions vanilla flavor mix is the very best tasting one that I have ever used (I have only tried the vanilla).  Mixes well, tastes rich and satisfying.  I highly recommend it.  I will be buying more.

My daughter and I love this drink.  It has helped me maintain my weight with out any problems.  I mix with frozen ice and frozen cut up fruit. It is delicious and stays with you. I try to have it at least once a day.  Unfortunetly they stopped selling it in my gnc and wallmart stores because they claim carb is out. I do not take it for any thing to do with carbs but it is high protein and filling. Good Luck

this is the best tasting meal replacement protein on the market. if you put it in a bowl of oatmeal with fruit and add a little splenda, you will have a very healthy meal. you will also never stop eating it believe me.

I have tried a TON of protein shakes and I always come back to Carb Solutions. I first tried them when they came Read-to-drink a few years ago, then they only came in powder form, then I couldn't find the powder form anywhere except drugstore.com (if you buy on Amazon it ships from drugstore.com.Vanilla is my favorite, but chocolate is pretty good too. I have these as meal replacements for weight loss and maintenance. I use 8 oz. water, 2 scoops of carb solutions, a tbs. or so of Jello-O pudding mix powder (my fav is cookies n creme), a tbs. of groud flax, a little vanilla, a packet of splenda, and blend in myHamilton Beach 51101B Single-Serve Blender with Travel Lid, Black(which you can also get at Wal-mart). Once that's blended I add about 5 or six ice cubes and blend again. It's delicious and filling! I like to experiment mixing different flavors of Jell-O pudding mix (regular or sugar free)and also fruit; such as chocolate cherry cheesecake which is the same recipe as above except with chocolate carb solutions, sugar-free cheesecake Jello-O Pudding mix, and a few frozen cherries!This shake mix is so versatile and I can make so many different varieties I never get bored with it. My only complaint is the price! But I guess it's not too bad if you consider I'm replacing 2 meals a day with it or think of it the same cost as a couple of trips to McDonald's but healthier. Anyway, I highly recommend it!P.S. if you buy the Carb Solutions regularly, keep an eye out because sometimes they have it on sale for $9.99, it was on sale last week so I bought 5!
summary: The Best Low Carb Protein Shake!

reviewText: I have tried many different low carb protein shakes and only one tasted better than this one (but it costs twice the money). I have it for breakfast and it lasts me until lunch - six hours later. This is a great bargain!
I love this shake mix, it taste good and is very filling!

We are very pleased with the quality and taste of this product.  Pharmacist have suggested other high protein shakes, we have tried them and found them all to be inferior to Carb Solutions.  Our only regret is that it is so hard to find.

My body has a problem absorbing nutrients, so it holds on to everything (!) I eat. The result is a pretty big me. I want to change this, so I figured I would try a nutritional shake. However, looking at the stores I found that most shakes, premixed or powder, only have about 30% of vitamins per serving. Then I found Carb Solutions. I bought the Vanilla one because many of the chocolate shakes are just too chocolaty for me. I don't like mixing anything with water, so I decided to go with a mix of 1% milk and ice. After fine tuning it, I now use5 oz 1% milk and 6 oz of crushed ice. I first mix the shake with the milk, then I add the ice to the blender and mix until smooth. This shake comes out thick and creamy. Better yet, I found it is the perfect breakfast shake. I have one after I get to work and it curbs my appetite until lunch. Added bonus, with the extra milk I make it to a recommended daily intake of 90% calcium and 65% vitamine D and E! That is fabulous. I then have a light lunch, some small snacks, and eat a normal dinner with the hubby. After the holidays are over I plan on 2 shakes a day and one meal to see if I can loose some weight, unless I can see a healthy difference within the next 4 weeks.For now I think this is a great tasting shake that I can buy at HEB for $12.92, so about $1 per serving!

Product gets me moving in the morning and off to work.  Not that heavy and I always throw in a piece of fruit and ice.  A low-carb smoothie.  It is ok without the fruit; but a more substantial drink with it.  Chocolate is good too, and they used to make strawberry, but I can't find it anymore.

This is a great shake mix with lots of vitamins and minerals; and it's cheap.  I blend it with Hill Bros (or Great Value) French Vanilla Cappuccino.  Here's the recipe I use: 1 cup milk, 8-10 ice cubes, 2 scoops shake mix, 1 scoop Instant Cappuccino, 45 seconds in the blender.  Super yummy!
summary: Awesome taste when blended with Instant Cappuccino

reviewText: I found this stuff to be seriously nasty - both in chocolate and vanilla.  Nothing I've done has improved the flavor or terrible texture. I've tried mixing it in a shaker (too much sludge at the bottom that doesn't mix in no matter what), using my blender with crushed ice (still ick) and even in my blender with ice and various fresh fruits, as well as an extra packet or two of sweetener and even some various flavored extracts to boost the flavor.  It was still seriously nasty. I took this product on vacation, thinking that it would be easier to pack (and it was - I used big ziplock storage baggies) than the delightful prepared SlimFast meal drink I'm used to.  What a huge disappointment.  Spend the extra and get the SlimFast Meal drink.Now the big question is - what do I do with the four canisters that I've already spent nearly $50 to purchase?????
summary: Please don't waste your hard earned cash on this stuff!!!!

reviewText: I have been drinking Carb Solution Shakes for many years now.  It is the best one I have ever tried, no sugar, low on calories, high in protein.  And what is great about the vanilla is you can mix just about anything with it.  I put in a tablespoon of unsweetened dark chocolate powder and some ice cubes in the blender with a 1/2 cup of water and it becomes a very thick chocolate milkshake.  Fabulous.  They say to use two of the measuring cups but I only use one and it is still good and thick.  Just wish it came on sale more often.
summary: Best Protein Shake I have ever used!

reviewText: I have tried other low carb products like protein bars and did not like the granular texture and unpleasant musty flavor with its unnatural aftertaste that they usually have so I avoid them. I was hesitant to use protein shakes because I was not about to drink something that would make me want to gag. Vanilla is a hard flavor to replicate and can taste very fake.When I tried this the flavor and it was not only tolerable, it was quite tasty. I am glad I tried this and will be buying it in the future to add to my slow carb diet. The only drawback to this was that I ended up with some lumps and this is probably because I used a shaker. I think that this can be worked out as I learn the quirks of this product. If you want to avoid lumps altogether, it may be best to use a blender.

After doing low carb very successfully for a few years and trying every low carb product on the market, Carb solutions is a product I love and is well worth your consideration. Low carb meal replacement powder is hard to come by now a days mostly it's pre-made single serving shakes being sold for about $2 each, this powder is the cheapest low carb product you will find. The taste is simply heaven both chocolate and vanilla, I suggest buying both and alternating each day. I look forward to my daily lunch shake it is absolutely delicious with no chalkiness or aftertaste. I hesitate to say it is a tad thick not really enough to even consider not buying, the instructions say mix with 8 OZ. water, I use 10 OZ. and it's fine. Hope this review helps.

I started with Carb Solutions, and since have tried two more brands (all vanilla), to compare what's available.  I already knew that I like the Atkins shakes, which are in a convenient can. I liked the Carb Solutions and Atkins shakes equally.  No aftertaste with either, and I actually do prefer a powder at home, with the blender.  I did not like the other two powders.I first tried Carb Solutions just stirred into water with a spoon, and it stirred up very well, but not as well as the blender, of course, which also gives it a little froth.  It tastes very good and curbs my hunger very well.  Sucralose doesn't give me an aftertaste.  I haven't yet tried with ice cubes, but I've added berries, bananas, peanut butter (no sugar), vanilla, espresso or blackberry powder (for my eyes).My decision is to let Carb Solutions be my mainstay at home for milk type shakes.  Atkins for take with.  I also have a greens, vegetables and fruit powder, as well as blackberry powder, and a joints supplement powder that I will blend with fresh fruits and vegetables, for a change.I allow myself to drink as much as I want of this type of drink and am losing weight.  Currently no white carbs is my only rule.  I added the drinks to give me a kind of treat, but I find that in the evening, it's all I want - 1 or 2 of these.  Keeps me from going whole hog when making a meal, too.One warning, be careful if you are allergic to some of the types of additives in any of this type of drink.  Read the label.  Do the research.

I first bought Carb Solutions as a diet aid.  I immediately discovered that when I drink a shake for breakfast, my energy level stays wonderfully "Up" throughout the day.  I previously ate a high fiber breakfast cereal for breakfast, but would be dosing at my computer by early afternoon.  Now, I will never quit having my Carb Solutions shake for breakfast on workdays.  I prefer the vanilla because there is so much you can do with it.  Make it with orange juice and it tastes like an Orange Julius.  Or, toss a handful of blueberries into it for the extra shot of lutein.  I hope this company stays in business forever!(P.S. This powder works better if mixed in a blender.)
summary: Carb Solutions keeps my energy level up all day!

reviewText: I have been using Carb Solutions in conjunction with my Atkins program. I have to say that this is the best tasting shake mix I have EVER tasted! It mixes up beautifully in the blender and is so delicious! I highly recommend it!

I ordered these before and they were find. The product this time was hard, not chewy, as if it had been stored for awhile.Sorry that I can not recommend buying this product on-line. Go to the store and save time and money. Thank you

reviewText: These arrived in a melted blob, but I was able to pull pieces off after letting the box sit in an air conditioned room for the afternoon. That's when I discovered that the caramel inside was rock hard. How long have these been sitting in your warehouse? What's not to like??The price here on Amazon saved me a small fortune on this batch, wish they have them on Subscribe and Save for this steal of a price...but I am happy to have gotten this deal even if not! reviewText: If I'm going to pay triple retail price for a bag of jellybeans I would expect them to be fresh.  They are stale and garbage.

This is awesome.  It tastes like the fake marshmallows they put in immoral breakfast cereal, but instead of just tasting like sugar it tastes like fat as well.  I can't believe I never tried this stuff until now, but I am definitely going to keep a stack of these in my desk.Disclosure:1. Your block of "ice cream" WILL be broken into a bunch of smaller chunks.  It is so brittle that they probably all end up like that (this was the first one I ate, but one reason I passed on this stuff so many times is because I could tell by picking up the package that they were always broken).2. Partly for the above reason, astronauts don't actually eat this stuff any more.  Wikipedia says it was used on one mission and was found to be inconvenient.  Also, they have a freezer on the space station and just eat real ice cream.In spite of those facts, this stuff is delicious.

Despite all the cool things to see in the museum, the girls could not stop raving about the "space ice cream." DC is a bit of a hike from NY/NJ, so I needed to find an alternative solution to their demands for more space dessert. With Amazon Prime, a massive box of the novelty ice-cream delivered to my door in a matter of days.The quality is the same as what you would buy at the Air and Space Museum and it's a great treat for the kids. reviewText: I wanted something appropriate for a space-themed raffle prize and this filled the bill nicely.  The shipping took a bit longer than I expected but it arrived in time and considering that the East Coast was still recovering from Hurricane Sandy, the seller did quite well.I never did see who won the raffle prize so I have no feedback on this particular batch, but I've had freeze-dried ice cream before and loved it so I'm betting it went over well. It felt like the "bricks" inside the pouches were broken but they always are so that wasn't an issue.  Someday I will order this again and eat it all myself.

Neapolitan is, as far as I'm concerned, a useless flavor of ice cream. Oddly enough, I like it best of all flavors of Astronaut Ice cream.  Each of the three flavors has its own unique appeal and the three together make a good very combination.  I like the smooth textures more than any of the flavors that have crunchy or chewy bits added to them although in real ice cream the only ones I really like are Ben and Jerry's which I refer to as cookies (or candy) in cream sauce.  Still, food is such an individual thing that writing a meaningful review is difficult. I've met people who absolutely cannot stand any of the freeze dried ice cream flavors and I am an unusual person; I don't like ice cream for the most part.
summary: It has an interesting, funky appeal

Luckily this product stays fresh in just a ziplock bag for at least a week. I put most of these in a gallon ziplock and saved several ounces in weight over ditching the stock packaging material. Gave some to my son and he loved them as well - they make a great/unique gift to kids.

If you've ever had freeze dried ice cream before, this is the stuff. The size of each treat isn't very large, but definitely enough to enjoy. Each bar is individually wrapped. It is also lots of fun to give to anyone who hasn't had it before.If you don't know what freeze dried ice cream is, it is pretty straight forward. All of the water is removed from normal ice cream in a special way. First the ice cream is kept frozen while a vacuum is applied to it. The vacuum causes water to slowly sublimate and vaporize. The vaporized water is eventually all sucked out and you are left with a chunk of ice cream that has everything in it but water. Note, it doesn't melt. The process brings water straight from the solid to gas. This technique is used for lots of foods because it makes the food last forever -- without water most bacteria and molds simply can't grow. If you are a hippie, feel safe. The process doesn't use any crazy chemical science that'll kill your mojo.

I saw this item and it brought back memories of my childhood visits to the science and industry museum, so I decided to order a pack of it. It arrived before the expected arrival time and was just as delicious as I remembered it. A definite recommended buy.
